ygData.subject: Re: Restarting Heritrix 3.0.0 keeps failing
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi, now I figured out, what is happening. Heritrix is starting - but is taking about 15 to 20 minutes to start. When started it takes again an enormous amount

Hi,

now I figured out, what is happening. Heritrix is starting - but is ta=
king about 15 to 20 minutes to start. When started it takes again an enormo=
us amount of time to answer the first http-request. 

I tried to understand=
 that "issue" and used jstack. There I could see, that Heritrix is calling =
the method "CrawlJob.scanJobLog", first when starting and again when creati=
ng the first output. I assume that heritrix is reading the "job.log" which =
takes a lot of time with my current 8 GB sized job.log-file.

Are there any=
 options how to speed up things? Or should that be considered a bug? Perhap=
s it is simple not a good idea to start the webgui with such big crawls?

C=
heers,
Tino

P.S.: the relevant stack-trace:

> Hi,
> 
> th=
anks for your advice. But when using 'netstat -an | egrep 'LISTEN'' the def=
ault port 8443 of heritrix is not listening. Additionally I made sure that =
the java process doesn't show up in the process list of 'top'.
> 
> When I =
look at the output of heritrix_out.log when starting the engine there are n=
o exceptions - just some system information. Any ideas what I could do to s=
tart the engine again?
> 
> Cheers,
> Tino

- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Pranay Pandey <sspranay@> wrote:
> >
=
> > 
> > Look at the heritrix_out.log in $HERITRIX_HOME for some clue.
> > =
I suspect your signal isn't killing all the processes properly. I use kill =
-9 and it guarantees a sure shot heritrix termination. 
> > Did you netstat=
 for the port used by heritrix? I am quite sure, the default port would sho=
w up as occupied. Kill that process and you should be good to restart the e=
ngine.
> > 
> > -Pranay
> > 
> > --- On Sun, 1/17/10, t.schoellhorn <t.scho=
ellhorn@> wrote:

ritrix 3.0.0 to crawl snaphshots of about 500 Web-Sites. Now I had to resta=
rt the Heritrix Engine. As I don't know the recommended way to stop the eng=
ine I "killed" it via its process number (with signal 15).

>=
 > The problem now is: I cannot restart the engine. When starting the engin=
g with "bin/heritrix -a admin:admin" the progress dots appear enlessly.
